verses.verse: And Jacob<WH3290> dwelled<WH3427> in the land<WH776> wherein his father<WH1> was a stranger,<WH4033> in the land<WH776> of Canaan.<WH3667>

These<WH428> are the generations<WH8435> of Jacob.<WH3290> Joseph,<WH3130> being seventeen<WH7651> <WH6240> years<WH8141> old,<WH1121> was feeding<WH7462> the flock<WH6629> with his brothers;<WH251> and the lad<WH5288> was with the sons<WH1121> of Bilhah,<WH1090> and with the sons<WH1121> of Zilpah,<WH2153> his father's<WH1> wives:<WH802> and Joseph<WH3130> brought<WH935> to his father<WH1> their evil<WH7451> report.<WH1681>

Now Israel<WH3478> loved<WH157> Joseph<WH3130> more than all<WH3605> his children,<WH1121> because<WH3588> he was the son<WH1121> of his old<WH2208> age: and he made<WH6213> him a coat<WH3801> of many colors.<WH6446>

And when his brothers<WH251> saw<WH7200> that their father<WH1> loved<WH157> him more than all<WH3605> his brothers,<WH251> they hated<WH8130> him, and could<WH3201> not speak<WH1696> peaceably<WH7965> to him.
And Joseph<WH3130> dreamed<WH2492> a dream,<WH2472> and he told<WH5046> it his brothers:<WH251> and they hated<WH8130> him yet<WH5750> the more.<WH3254>
And he said<WH559> to them, Hear,<WH8085> I pray<WH4994> you, this<WH2088> dream<WH2472> which<WH834> I have dreamed:<WH2492>

For, behold,<WH2009> we were binding<WH481> sheaves<WH485> in the field,<WH7704> and, see,<WH2009> my sheaf<WH485> arose,<WH6965> and also stood<WH5324> upright; and, behold,<WH2009> your sheaves<WH485> stood round<WH5437> about, and made obeisance<WH7812> to my sheaf.<WH485>

And his brothers<WH251> said<WH559> to him, Shall you indeed reign<WH4427> over<WH5921> us? or shall you indeed have dominion<WH4910> over us? And they hated<WH8130> him yet<WH5750> the more<WH3254> for his dreams,<WH2472> and for his words.<WH1697>

And he dreamed<WH2492> yet<WH5750> another<WH312> dream,<WH2472> and told<WH5608> it his brothers,<WH251> and said,<WH559> Behold,<WH2009> I have dreamed<WH2492> a dream<WH2472> more;<WH5750> and, behold,<WH2009> the sun<WH8121> and the moon<WH3394> and the eleven<WH259> <WH6240> stars<WH3556> made obeisance<WH7812> to me.

And he told<WH5608> it to his father,<WH1> and to his brothers:<WH251> and his father<WH1> rebuked<WH1605> him, and said<WH559> to him, What<WH4100> is this<WH2088> dream<WH2472> that you have dreamed?<WH2492> Shall I and your mother<WH517> and your brothers<WH251> indeed come<WH935> to bow<WH7812> down<WH7812> ourselves to you to the earth?<WH776>
And his brothers<WH251> envied<WH7065> him; but his father<WH1> observed<WH8104> the saying.<WH1697>
And his brothers<WH251> went<WH3212> to feed<WH7462> their father's<WH1> flock<WH6629> in Shechem.<WH7927>

And Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> to Joseph,<WH3130> Do not your brothers<WH251> feed<WH7462> the flock in Shechem?<WH7927> come,<WH3212> and I will send<WH7971> you to them. And he said<WH559> to him, Here<WH2009> am I.

And he said<WH559> to him, Go,<WH3212> I pray<WH4994> you, see<WH7200> whether it be well<WH7965> with your brothers,<WH251> and well<WH7965> with the flocks;<WH6629> and bring<WH7725> me word<WH1697> again.<WH7725> So he sent<WH7971> him out of the vale<WH6010> of Hebron,<WH2275> and he came<WH935> to Shechem.<WH7927>
And a certain man<WH376> found<WH4672> him, and, behold,<WH2009> he was wandering<WH8582> in the field:<WH7704> and the man<WH376> asked<WH7592> him, saying,<WH559> What<WH4100> seek<WH1245> you?
And he said,<WH559> I seek<WH1245> my brothers:<WH251> tell<WH5046> me, I pray<WH4994> you, where<WH375> they feed<WH7462> their flocks.

And the man<WH376> said,<WH559> They are departed<WH5265> hence;<WH2088> for I heard<WH8085> them say,<WH559> Let us go<WH3212> to Dothan.<WH1886> And Joseph<WH3130> went<WH3212> after<WH310> his brothers,<WH251> and found<WH4672> them in Dothan.<WH1886>
And when they saw<WH7200> him afar<WH7350> off, even before<WH2962> he came<WH7126> near<WH7126> to them, they conspired<WH5230> against<WH834> him to slay<WH4191> him.
And they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another,<WH251> Behold,<WH2009> this<WH1976> dreamer<WH1167> <WH2472> comes.<WH935>

Come<WH3212> now<WH6258> therefore, and let us slay<WH2026> him, and cast<WH7993> him into some<WH259> pit,<WH953> and we will say,<WH559> Some evil<WH7451> beast<WH2416> has devoured<WH398> him: and we shall see<WH7200> what<WH4100> will become<WH1961> of his dreams.<WH2472>
And Reuben<WH7205> heard<WH8085> it, and he delivered<WH5337> him out of their hands;<WH3027> and said,<WH559> Let us not kill<WH5221> him.

And Reuben<WH7205> said<WH559> to them, Shed<WH8210> no<WH3808> blood,<WH1818> but cast<WH7993> him into<WH413> this<WH2088> pit<WH953> that is in the wilderness,<WH4057> and lay<WH7971> no<WH3808> hand<WH3027> on him; that he might rid<WH5337> him out of their hands,<WH3027> to deliver<WH7725> him to his father<WH1> again.<WH7725>

And it came<WH1961> to pass, when<WH834> Joseph<WH3130> was come<WH935> to his brothers,<WH251> that they stripped<WH6584> Joseph<WH3130> out of his coat,<WH3801> his coat<WH3801> of many colors<WH6446> that was on<WH5921> him;
And they took<WH3947> him, and cast<WH7993> him into a pit:<WH953> and the pit<WH953> was empty,<WH7386> there was no<WH3808> water<WH4325> in it.

And they sat<WH3427> down to eat<WH398> bread:<WH3899> and they lifted<WH5375> up their eyes<WH5869> and looked,<WH7200> and, behold,<WH2009> a company<WH736> of Ishmeelites<WH3459> came<WH935> from Gilead<WH1568> with their camels<WH1581> bearing<WH5375> spices<WH5219> and balm<WH6875> and myrrh,<WH3910> going<WH1980> to carry<WH3381> it down<WH3381> to Egypt.<WH4714>
And Judah<WH3063> said<WH559> to his brothers,<WH251> What<WH4100> profit<WH1215> is it if<WH3588> we slay<WH2026> our brother,<WH251> and conceal<WH3680> his blood?<WH1818>

Come,<WH3212> and let us sell<WH4376> him to the Ishmeelites,<WH3459> and let not our hand<WH3027> be on him; for he is our brother<WH251> and our flesh.<WH1320> And his brothers<WH251> were content.<WH8085>

Then there passed<WH5674> by Midianites<WH4084> merchants;<WH5503> and they drew<WH4900> and lifted<WH5927> up Joseph<WH3130> out of the pit,<WH953> and sold<WH4376> Joseph<WH3130> to the Ishmeelites<WH3459> for twenty<WH6242> pieces of silver:<WH3701> and they brought<WH935> Joseph<WH3130> into Egypt.<WH4714>
And Reuben<WH7205> returned<WH7725> to the pit;<WH953> and, behold,<WH2009> Joseph<WH3130> was not in the pit;<WH953> and he rent<WH7167> his clothes.<WH899>
And he returned<WH7725> to his brothers,<WH251> and said,<WH559> The child<WH3206> is not; and I, where<WH575> shall I go?<WH935>
And they took<WH3947> Joseph's<WH3130> coat,<WH3801> and killed<WH7819> a kid<WH8163> of the goats,<WH5795> and dipped<WH2881> the coat<WH3801> in the blood;<WH1818>

And they sent<WH7971> the coat<WH3801> of many colors,<WH6446> and they brought<WH935> it to their father;<WH1> and said,<WH559> This<WH2063> have we found:<WH4672> know<WH5234> now<WH4994> whether it be your son's<WH1121> coat<WH3801> or no.<WH3808>
And he knew<WH5234> it, and said,<WH559> It is my son's<WH1121> coat;<WH3801> an evil<WH7451> beast<WH2416> has devoured<WH398> him; Joseph<WH3130> is without<WH2963> doubt rent<WH2963> in pieces.
And Jacob<WH3290> rent<WH7167> his clothes,<WH8071> and put<WH7760> sackcloth<WH8242> on his loins,<WH4975> and mourned<WH56> for his son<WH1121> many<WH7227> days.<WH3117>

And all<WH3605> his sons<WH1121> and all<WH3605> his daughters<WH1323> rose<WH6965> up to comfort<WH5162> him; but he refused<WH3985> to be comforted;<WH5162> and he said,<WH559> For I will go<WH3381> down<WH3381> into the grave<WH7585> to my son<WH1121> mourning.<WH57> Thus his father<WH1> wept<WH1058> for him.
And the Midianites<WH4092> sold<WH4376> him into<WH413> Egypt<WH4714> to Potiphar,<WH6318> an officer<WH5631> of Pharaoh's,<WH6547> and captain<WH8269> of the guard.<WH2876>
